results.title: Octikuki
results.brief_description: Octikuki uses 2D and 3D computer animation to create a futuristic creation scene. The animation plays with themes nature and science reading as a visual poem. The music soundtrack ‘Sweet Thunder’ is by Yello.

results.title: Oceans of science
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, ONF | NFB, Bane Jovanovic, Douglas Kiefer and Jean-Pierre Lachapelle
results.brief_description: Shows what fisheries science is doing, both afloat and ashore, to ensure that life survives in the seas and inland waters. Projects on Canada’s three sea coasts and in many inland waters illustrate the vital and intriguing research directed towards restoring and protecting marine life. The film is encouraging evidence that old abuses of the great provider can be corrected and safeguards established.

results.title: Oceanography at work
results.creator_credit: Willard Bascom, Coronet Instructional Films and Ocean Science and Engineering
results.brief_description: Shows scientific methods of diamond prospecting under the sea. Geologists on the “Xhosa” use seismic surveys co-ordinated with land based radar beacons to map the ocean floor. The divers using underwater television probe for rock samples. Another ship, the “Rock-eater”, caps the search by drilling into a charted gravel deposit to bring diamonds from under the sea.

results.title: Ocean Wanderers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
Second in a series on the wildlife of Macquarie Island. The film shows the life cycles of the Wandering Albatross, the Rockhopper Penguin, the Black Browed Albatross and the Grey Headed Albatross

results.title: Ocean pastures
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
The life-cycle of the creatures living at, and in, the sea along the south-eastern Australian shore line. Tiny plankton provide foodstuff for birds and numerous small fish, whilst birds and bigger fish eat the smaller fish. Studies the sea gulls, terns, and the short tailed sheer-water. The fairy penguin and the Australian fur seal are also featured; and underwater life such as seahorses, crabs, octypus, stingrays and sharks. Narrated by Peter Wagner and devised by naturalist, Graham Pizzey.

results.title: Ocean oddities
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions, Australian Educational Films and Noel Monkman
results.brief_description: The coral structure of the Great Barrier Reef provides protection for a number of creatures such as the stone-fish, the giant mantis shrimp,the crown of thorns seastar, the black beche-de-mer and the green turtle.

results.title: Ocean liners
results.brief_description: Brief but remarkable thorough document of the life of an ocean liner. Presents footage of ship construction in the shipyards and launching of the ship. Then goes into a description, using animated cross-sections, of the layout - cargo holds, fuel tanks, crew quarters, passenger quarters. Shows inspection of the crew prior to departure, life on board and the liner arriving at its destination.
